metadata.dc:author: Resoagli, E H
Miropé Santa Cruz, A C
Ortíz de Rott, M I
metadata.dc:description: A case of caecum nematodiasis is described in a guinea fowl (Numida melagris) from the Municipal Zoo, Presidencia Roque Saenz Peña (Chaco) Argentina. Nematodes obtained from the caecum were observed in optic microscopy. According to their morphometric characteristics and location in the definitive host, were identified as belonging to the family Heterakidae, species Heterakis gallinarum, (Schrank, 1788) Maden, 1949.
metadata.dc:title: Heterakiosis en Numida meleagris (Aves: Numididae).
[Heterakis infection in Numida meleagris (Numididae)].
